intro: Pedicularis przewalskii subsp. microphyton, commonly known as the small-leaved lousewort, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the genus Pedicularis, which is part of the family Orobanchaceae, known for its parasitic or hemiparasitic species. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
